greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of -x/((x^2+x+1)*(x^2+3*x+1)); Invert transform gives signed version of Tetrahedral numbers A000292.
comment: Binomial(a(n)) gives (0, -1, 2, -2, 4, -7, 10) = A094686 (with alternating signs, from 2nd term).
reference: C. Dement, Floretion Integer Sequences (work in progress).
link: Colin Barker, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (-4,-5,-4,-1).
formula: (|a(n)|) = A290890(n) for n >= 0, this being the p-INVERT of (1,2,3,4,...), where p(S) = 1 - S^2.  - _Clark Kimberling_, Aug 21 2017
a(n) = -4*a(n-1) - 5*a(n-2) - 4*a(n-3) - a(n-4) for n>3. - _Colin Barker_, May 11 2019
program: Floretion Algebra Multiplication Program, FAMP Code: 2basei[C*F]; C = - .5'j + .5'k - .5j' + .5k' - 'ii' - .5'ij' - .5'ik' - .5'ji' - .5'ki'; F = + .5'i + .5'ii' + .5'ij' + .5'ik'
(Sage) [((lucas_number1(n,3,1)-lucas_number1(n,1,1)))/(-2) for n in range(1,32)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jul 06 2008
(PARI) concat(0, Vec(-x / ((1 + x + x^2)*(1 + 3*x + x^2)) + O(x^30))) \\ _Colin Barker_, May 11 2019
results.author: _Creighton Dement_, Oct 13 2005
